medical_history.chief_complaint: Chest pain, cough, and dyspnea on exertion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 2 months of age, when she experienced bronchiolitis. After that, she had repeated respiratory illnesses characterized by wheezing and cyanosis. At age 6, she had a spontaneous pneumothorax. Over the next 16 years, dyspnea on exertion and decreased exercise tolerance developed slowly, worsening over the 12 months prior to presentation. Approximately 6 weeks before presentation, intermittent sharp chest pain developed, occurring both at rest and with exertion, not relieved by ibuprofen. Chest pain continued every few days until the current visit. Recently, exercise capacity declined over the past month, and a 1-week history of productive cough began, with clear sputum changing to dark yellow and blood-tinged.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of bronchiolitis at 2 months, recurrent respiratory illnesses requiring hospitalization, spontaneous pneumothorax at age 6, history of depression. Medications include sertraline and inhaled albuterol as needed.
medical_history.family_history: Younger brother had a seizure disorder and developmental delays; mother exhibited joint hypermobility; father was healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Fluent in English and Spanish, undergraduate student living on campus during the academic year and at parents' home during breaks. No alcohol consumption, smoking, or illicit drug use.
